00017 =head1 NAME
00018 
00019 contextLimitedPowers.pl - Restrict the base or power allowed in exponentials.
00020 
00021 =head1 DESCRIPTION
00022 
00023 Implements subclasses of the "^" operator that restrict
00024 the base or power that is allowed.  There are four
00025 available restrictions:
00026 
00027     No raising e to a power
00028     Only allowing integer powers (positive or negative)
00029     Only allowing positive integer powers
00030     Only allowing positive integer powers (and 0)
00031 
00032 You install these via one of the commands:
00033 
00034     LimitedPowers::NoBaseE();
00035     LimitedPowers::OnlyIntegers();
00036     LimitedPowers::OnlyPositiveIntegers();
00037     LimitedPowers::OnlyNonNegativeIntegers();
00038 
00039 Only one of the three can be in effect at a time; setting
00040 a second one overrides the first.
00041 
00042 These function affect the current context, or you can pass
00043 a context reference, as in
00044 
00045     $context = Context("Numeric")->copy;
00046     LimitedPowers::OnlyIntegers($context);
00047 
00048 For the integer power functions, you can pass additional
00049 parameters that control the range of values that are allowed
00050 for the powers.  The oprtions include:
00051 
00052 =over
00053 
00054 =item S<C<< minPower => m >>>
00055 
00056 only integer powers bigger than or equal
00057 to m are allowed.  (If m is undef, then
00058 there is no minimum power.)
00059 
00060 =item S<C<< maxPower => M >>>
00061 
00062 only integer powers less than or equal
00063 to M are allowed.  (If M is undef, then
00064 there is no maximum power.)
00065 
00066 =item S<C<< message => "text" >>>
00067 
00068 a description of the type of power
00069 allowed (e.g., "positive integer constants");
00070 
00071 =item S<C<< checker => code >>>
00072 
00073 a reference to a subroutine that will be
00074 used to check if the powers are acceptable.
00075 It should accept a reference to the BOP::power
00076 structure and return 1 or 0 depending on
00077 whether the power is OK or not.
00078 
00079 =back
00080 
00081 For example:
00082 
00083     LimitedPowers::OnlyIntegers(
00084         minPower => -5, maxPower => 5,
00085         message => "integer constants between -5 and 5",
00086     );
00087 
00088 would accept only powers between -5 and 5, while
00089 
00090     LimitedPowers::OnlyIntegers(
00091         checker => sub {
00092             return 0 unless LimitedPowers::isInteger(@_);
00093             my $self = shift; my $p = shift; # the power as a constant
00094             return $p != 0 && $p != 1;
00095         },
00096         message => "integer constants other than 0 or 1",
00097     );
00098 
00099 would accept any integer power other than 0 and 1.
00100 
00101 =cut
00102 
00103 loadMacros("MathObjects.pl");
00104 
00105 sub _contextLimitedPowers_init {}; # don't load it again
00106 
00107 package LimitedPowers;
00108 
00109 sub NoBaseE {
00110   my $context = (Value::isContext($_[0]) ? shift : Value->context);
00111   $context->operators->set(
00112     '^'  => {class => 'LimitedPowers::NoBaseE', isCommand=>1, perl=>'LimitedPowers::NoBaseE->_eval', @_},
00113     '**' => {class => 'LimitedPowers::NoBaseE', isCommand=>1, perl=>'LimitedPowers::NoBaseE->_eval', @_},
00114   );
00115 }
00116 
00117 sub OnlyIntegers {
00118   my $context = (Value::isContext($_[0]) ? shift : Value->context);
00119   $context->operators->set(
00120     '^'  => {class => 'LimitedPowers::OnlyIntegers', message => "integer constants", @_},
00121     '**' => {class => 'LimitedPowers::OnlyIntegers', message => "integer constants",@_},
00122   );
00123 }
00124 
00125 sub OnlyNonNegativeIntegers {
00126   my $context = (Value::isContext($_[0]) ? shift : Value->context);
00127   OnlyIntegers($context, minPower=>0, message=>"non-negative integer constants", @_);
00128 }
00129 
00130 sub OnlyPositiveIntegers {
00131   my $context = (Value::isContext($_[0]) ? shift : Value->context);
00132   OnlyIntegers($context, minPower => 1, message => "positive integer constants", @_);
00133 }
00134 
00135 sub OnlyNonTrivialPositiveIntegers {
00136   my $context = (Value::isContext($_[0]) ? shift : Value->context);
00137   OnlyIntegers($context, minPower=>2, message=>"integer constants bigger than 1", @_);
00138 }
00139 
00140 #
00141 #  Test for whether the power is an integer in the specified range
00142 #
00143 sub isInteger {
00144   my $self = shift; my $n = shift;
00145   my $def = $self->{def};
00146   return 0 if defined($def->{minPower}) && $n < $def->{minPower};
00147   return 0 if defined($def->{maxPower}) && $n > $def->{maxPower};
00148   return Value::Real->make($n - int($n)) == 0;
00149 }
00150 
00151 #
00152 #  Legacy code to accommodate older approach to setting the operators
00153 #
00154 our @NoBaseE = (
00155   '^'  => {class => 'LimitedPowers::NoBaseE', isCommand=>1, perl=>'LimitedPowers::NoBaseE->_eval'},
00156   '**' => {class => 'LimitedPowers::NoBaseE', isCommand=>1, perl=>'LimitedPowers::NoBaseE->_eval'},
00157 );
00158 our @OnlyIntegers = (
00159   '^'  => {class => 'LimitedPowers::OnlyIntegers', message => "integer constants"},
00160   '**' => {class => 'LimitedPowers::OnlyIntegers', message => "integer constants"},
00161 );
00162 our @OnlyNonNegativeIntegers = (
00163   '^'  => {class => 'LimitedPowers::OnlyIntegers', minPower => 0, message => "non-negative integer constants"},
00164   '**' => {class => 'LimitedPowers::OnlyIntegers', minPower => 0, message => "non-negative integer constants"},
00165 );
00166 our @OnlyPositiveIntegers = (
00167   '^'  => {class => 'LimitedPowers::OnlyIntegers', minPower => 1, message => "positive integer constants"},
00168   '**' => {class => 'LimitedPowers::OnlyIntegers', minPower => 1, message => "positive integer constants"},
00169 );
00170 our @OnlyNonTrivialPositiveIntegers = (
00171   '^'  => {class => 'LimitedPowers::OnlyIntegers', minPower => 2, message => "integer constants bigger than 1"},
00172   '**' => {class => 'LimitedPowers::OnlyIntegers', minPower => 2, message => "integer constants bigger than 1"},
00173 );

00176 ##################################################
00177 
00178 package LimitedPowers::NoBaseE;
00179 @ISA = qw(Parser::BOP::power);
00180 
00181 my $e = CORE::exp(1);
00182 
00183 sub _check {
00184   my $self = shift;
00185   $self->SUPER::_check(@_);
00186   $self->Error("Can't raise e to a power") if $self->{lop}->string eq 'e';
00187 }
00188 
00189 sub _eval {
00190   my $self = shift;
00191   Value::cmp_Message("Can't raise e to a power") if $_[0] - $e == 0;
00192   $self->SUPER::_eval(@_);
00193 }
00194 
00195 ##################################################
00196 
00197 package LimitedPowers::OnlyIntegers;
00198 @ISA = qw(Parser::BOP::power);
00199 
00200 sub _check {
00201   my $self = shift; my $p = $self->{rop}; my $def = $self->{def};
00202   my $checker = (defined($def->{checker}) ? $def->{checker} :  \&LimitedPowers::isInteger);
00203   $self->SUPER::_check(@_);
00204   $self->Error("Powers must be $def->{message}")
00205     if $p->type ne 'Number' || !$p->{isConstant} || !&{$checker}($self,$p->eval);
00206 }
